Toolbox¶

Here is a list of all the toolboxes that are currently avaliable in isopy. The most common functions are avaliable in the isopypy.tb namespace. More specific functions/classes can be accessed via isopy.toolbox.<toolbox>.

Note that using from isopy.toolbox.<toolbox> import * will only import the functions present in isopy.tb. Use from isopy.toolbox import <toolbox> instead to import a specific toolbox.

General Data Processing¶

This toolbox contains functions for general data processing.

Avaliable in isopy.tb and isopy.toolbox.general

normalise_data(data, reference_values[, …])

Normalise data to the given reference values.

denomralise_data(data, reference_values[, …])

Normalise data to the given reference values.

find_outliers(data, lower_limit, upper_limit)

Find all outliers in data.

find_outliers_mad(data[, level, axis])

Find all outliers in data using the median absolute deviation.

Isotope Data Processing¶

This toolbox contains functions for processing of isotope data.

Avaliable in isopy.tb and isopy.toolbox.isotope

make_sample(element[, …])

Returns a simulated measurement for all isotopes of element.

mass_independent_correction(data, mf_ratio)

A quick function for mass-independent data correction.

calculate_mass_fractionation_factor(data, ratio)

Calculate the mass fractionation factor for a given ratio in data.

remove_mass_fractionation(data, …[, std_mass])

Remove exponential mass fractionation from the data.

add_mass_fractionation(data, …[, std_mass])

Add exponential mass fractionation to the data.

remove_isobaric_interferences(data, isotope)

Remove all isobaric interferences for a given element.

add_isobaric_interferences(data, isotope, value)

Add isobaric interferences of a given element to the data.

Miscellaneous¶

This toolbox contains miscellaneous functions and classes.

Avaliable in isopy.tb and isopy.toolbox.misc

york_regression(X, Y, Xerr, Yerr[, r, tol])

Calculate the slope and intercept taking into account the uncertainty on x and y.

plot_york_regression(axes, regression[, …])

Plots the regression within the limits of the supplies axes.

johnson_nyquist_noise(voltage[, resistor, …])

Calculate the Johnson-Nyquist noise and counting statistics for a given voltage.

Only avaliable in isopy.toolbox.misc

YorkRegression(slope, slope_error, …)

Returned by york_regression().

Numpy like functions¶

The functions in this toolbox behave like numpy functions.

Avaliable in isopy.tb and isopy.toolbox.np_like

sd(a[, axis])

Compute the standard deviation along the specified axis for N-1 degrees of freedom.

se(a[, axis])

Compute the standard error along the specified axis for N-1 degrees of freedom.

mad(a[, axis, scale])

Compute the median absolute deviation of the data along the given axis.

nansd(a[, axis])

Compute the standard deviation along the specified axis for N-1 degrees of freedom, while ignoring NaNs.

nanse(a[, axis])

Compute the standard error along the specified axis for N-1 degrees of freedom, while ignoring NaNs.

nanmad(a[, axis, scale])

Compute the median absolute deviation along the specified axis, while ignoring NaNs.
